info.description: The Microsoft Azure management API provides create, read, update, and delete functionality for Azure MariaDB resources including servers, databases, firewall rules, VNET rules, log files and configurations with new business model.
info.title: MariaDBManagementClient

get.description: Lists all of the available REST API operations.

parameters.description: The API version to use for the request.
parameters.name: api-version

schema.description: A list of resource provider operations.

value.description: The list of resource provider operations.

display.description: The localized display information for this particular operation or action.

operation.description: Localized friendly name for the operation.

resource.description: Resource on which the operation is performed.

name.description: The name of the operation being performed on this particular object.

origin.description: The intended executor of the operation.

properties.description: Additional descriptions for the operation.

display.description: Returns the list of Performance Tiers available.
Return the list of firewall rules for a server or gets the properties for the specified firewall rule.
Creates a firewall rule with the specified parameters or update an existing rule.
Return the list of servers or gets the properties for the specified server.
Creates a server with the specified parameters or update the properties or tags for the specified server.
Returns the list of Performance Tiers available.
Return the recoverable MariaDB Server info
Return types of metrics that are available for databases
Gets the disagnostic setting for the resource
Creates or updates the diagnostic setting for the resource

post.description: Check the availability of name for resource

parameters.description: The API version to use for the request.
parameters.name: api-version

parameters.description: The subscription ID that identifies an Azure subscription.
parameters.name: subscriptionId

nameAvailable.description: Indicates whether the resource name is available.

schema.description: Request from client to check resource name availability.

requestBody.description: The required parameters for checking if resource name is available.

get.description: List all the performance tiers at specified location in a given subscription.

parameters.name: api-version

parameters.description: The subscription ID that identifies an Azure subscription.
parameters.name: subscriptionId

parameters.description: The name of the location.
parameters.name: locationName

serviceLevelObjectives.description: Service level objectives associated with the performance tier

items.description: Service level objectives for performance tier.

hardwareGeneration.description: Hardware generation associated with the service level objective

id.description: ID for the service level objective.

maxBackupRetentionDays.description: Maximum Backup retention in days for the performance tier edition

maxStorageMB.description: Max storage allowed for a server.

minBackupRetentionDays.description: Minimum Backup retention in days for the performance tier edition

minStorageMB.description: Max storage allowed for a server.

vCore.description: vCore associated with the service level objective

get.description: List all the servers in a given subscription.

parameters.description: The API version to use for the request.
parameters.name: api-version

parameters.description: The subscription ID that identifies an Azure subscription.
parameters.name: subscriptionId

allOf.description: Resource properties including location and tags for track resources.

location.description: The location the resource resides in.

tags.description: Application-specific metadata in the form of key-value pairs.

properties.description: Properties of the server.

administratorLogin.description: The administrator's login name of a server. Can only be specified when the server is being created (and is required for creation).

earliestRestoreDate.description: Earliest restore point creation time (ISO8601 format)

fullyQualifiedDomainName.description: The fully qualified domain name of a server.

sslEnforcement.description: Enable ssl enforcement or not when connect to server.

backupRetentionDays.description: Backup retention days for the server.

geoRedundantBackup.description: Enable Geo-redundant or not for server backup.

storageMB.description: Max storage allowed for a server.

userVisibleState.description: A state of a server that is visible to user.

sku.description: The SKU (pricing tier) of the server.

capacity.description: The scale up/out capacity, representing server's compute units.

name.description: The name of the sku, typically, tier + family + cores, e.g. B_Gen4_1, GP_Gen5_8.

size.description: The size code, to be interpreted by resource as appropriate.

tier.description: The tier of the particular SKU, e.g. Basic.

get.description: List all the configurations in a given server.

parameters.description: The API version to use for the request.
parameters.name: api-version

parameters.description: The subscription ID that identifies an Azure subscription.
parameters.name: subscriptionId

parameters.description: The name of the resource group that contains the resource. You can obtain this value from the Azure Resource Manager API or the portal.
parameters.name: resourceGroupName

parameters.description: The name of the server.
parameters.name: serverName

properties.description: The properties of a configuration.
Indicates the status of the Event Scheduler.
Number of digits by which to increase the scale of the result of division operations.
Maximum allowed result length in bytes for the GROUP_CONCAT().
Whether innodb adaptive hash indexes are enabled or disabled.
The length of time in seconds an InnoDB transaction waits for a row lock before giving up.
Number of seconds the server waits for activity on an interactive connection before closing it.
Logs queries that are expected to retrieve all rows to slow query log.
Limits the number of such queries per minute that can be written to the slow query log.
Include slow administrative statements in the statements written to the slow query log.
When the slow query log is enabled, this variable enables logging for queries that have taken more than long_query_time seconds to execute on the slave.

This variable applies when binary logging is enabled. It controls whether stored function creators can be trusted not to create stored functions that will cause unsafe events to be written to the binary log.
If a query takes longer than this many seconds, the server increments the Slow_queries status variable.
Can be used to cause queries which examine fewer than the stated number of rows not to be logged.
Enable or disable the slow query log
The current server SQL mode.
The number of seconds the server waits for activity on a noninteractive connection before closing it.
The number of seconds the server waits for network reading action, especially for LOAD DATA LOCAL FILE.
The number of seconds the server waits for network writing action, especially for LOAD DATA LOCAL FILE.
The server ID, used in replication to give each master and slave a unique identity.
The maximum size of one packet or any generated/intermediate string, or any parameter sent by the mariadb_stmt_send_long_data() C API function.
The number of seconds to wait for more data from the master before the slave considers the connection broken, aborts the read, and tries to reconnect.
The server time zone
Controls how many microseconds the binary log commit waits before synchronizing the binary log file to disk.
The maximum number of transactions to wait for before aborting the current delay as specified by binlog-group-commit-sync-delay.
Use charset_name as the default server character set.
The minimum size of the buffer that is used for plain index scans, range index scans, and joins that do not use indexes and thus perform full table scans.
The number of open tables for all threads.
If set to 1, table names are stored in lowercase on disk and comparisons are not case sensitive. If set to 2, table names are stored as given but compared in lowercase.
This option places an upper limit on the total size in bytes of all relay logs on the slave.
Sets an upper limit on I/O activity performed by InnoDB background tasks, such as flushing pages from the buffer pool and merging data from the change buffer.
The number of I/O threads for read operations in InnoDB.
InnoDB tries to keep the number of operating system threads concurrently inside InnoDB less than or equal to the limit given by this variable.
The number of I/O threads for write operations in InnoDB.
The number of page cleaner threads that flush dirty pages from buffer pool instances.
Specifies an upper limit on the size of the temporary log files used during online DDL operations for InnoDB tables.
A string to be executed by the server for each client that connects.
The default transaction isolation level.

This variable indicates the number of equality ranges in an equality comparison condition when the optimizer should switch from using index dives to index statistics in estimating the number of qualifying rows.
Specifies the approximate percentage of the InnoDB buffer pool used for the old block sublist.
Non-zero values protect against the buffer pool being filled by data that is referenced only for a brief period, such as during a full table scan.
Controls the sensitivity of linear read-ahead that InnoDB uses to prefetch pages into the buffer pool.
The cutoff on the size of index values that determines which filesort algorithm to use.
If more than this many successive connection requests from a host are interrupted without a successful connection, the server blocks that host from further connections.
Defines how long InnoDB threads sleep before joining the InnoDB queue, in microseconds.
Indicates the InnoDB file format for file-per-table tablespaces.

get.description: Get a server's security alert policy.

parameters.description: The name of the resource group that contains the resource. You can obtain this value from the Azure Resource Manager API or the portal.
parameters.name: resourceGroupName

parameters.description: The name of the server.
parameters.name: serverName

parameters.description: The name of the security alert policy.
parameters.name: securityAlertPolicyName

parameters.description: The subscription ID that identifies an Azure subscription.
parameters.name: subscriptionId

parameters.description: The API version to use for the request.
parameters.name: api-version

200.description: Successfully retrieved the server threat detection policy.

properties.description: Resource properties.

disabledAlerts.description: Specifies an array of alerts that are disabled. Allowed values are: Sql_Injection, Sql_Injection_Vulnerability, Access_Anomaly

emailAccountAdmins.description: Specifies that the alert is sent to the account administrators.

emailAddresses.description: Specifies an array of e-mail addresses to which the alert is sent.

retentionDays.description: Specifies the number of days to keep in the Threat Detection audit logs.

state.description: Specifies the state of the policy, whether it is enabled or disabled.

storageAccountAccessKey.description: Specifies the identifier key of the Threat Detection audit storage account.

storageEndpoint.description: Specifies the blob storage endpoint (e.g. https://MyAccount.blob.core.windows.net). This blob storage will hold all Threat Detection audit logs.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation of getting security alert policies failed.

put.description: Creates or updates a threat detection policy.

parameters.description: The name of the resource group that contains the resource. You can obtain this value from the Azure Resource Manager API or the portal.
parameters.name: resourceGroupName

parameters.description: The name of the server.
parameters.name: serverName

parameters.description: The name of the threat detection policy.
parameters.name: securityAlertPolicyName

parameters.description: The subscription ID that identifies an Azure subscription.
parameters.name: subscriptionId

parameters.description: The API version to use for the request.
parameters.name: api-version

200.description: Successfully updated the threat detection policy.

properties.description: Resource properties.

disabledAlerts.description: Specifies an array of alerts that are disabled. Allowed values are: Sql_Injection, Sql_Injection_Vulnerability, Access_Anomaly

emailAccountAdmins.description: Specifies that the alert is sent to the account administrators.

emailAddresses.description: Specifies an array of e-mail addresses to which the alert is sent.

retentionDays.description: Specifies the number of days to keep in the Threat Detection audit logs.

state.description: Specifies the state of the policy, whether it is enabled or disabled.

storageAccountAccessKey.description: Specifies the identifier key of the Threat Detection audit storage account.

storageEndpoint.description: Specifies the blob storage endpoint (e.g. https://MyAccount.blob.core.windows.net). This blob storage will hold all Threat Detection audit logs.

202.description: Created request to set the server threat detection policy.

default.description: Error response describing why the operation of setting security alert policies failed.

properties.description: Resource properties.

disabledAlerts.description: Specifies an array of alerts that are disabled. Allowed values are: Sql_Injection, Sql_Injection_Vulnerability, Access_Anomaly

emailAccountAdmins.description: Specifies that the alert is sent to the account administrators.

emailAddresses.description: Specifies an array of e-mail addresses to which the alert is sent.

retentionDays.description: Specifies the number of days to keep in the Threat Detection audit logs.

state.description: Specifies the state of the policy, whether it is enabled or disabled.

storageAccountAccessKey.description: Specifies the identifier key of the Threat Detection audit storage account.

storageEndpoint.description: Specifies the blob storage endpoint (e.g. https://MyAccount.blob.core.windows.net). This blob storage will hold all Threat Detection audit logs.

default.description:
*** Error Responses: ***

 * 400 InvalidResourceId - Invalid resource identifier.

 * 400 MismatchingSubscriptionWithUrl - The provided subscription did not match the subscription in the Url.

 * 400 MismatchingResourceGroupNameWithUrl - The provided resource group name did not match the name in the Url.

 * 400 MismatchingServerNameWithUrl - The provided server name did not match the name in the Url.

 * 400 NullVirtualNetworkRequest - Virtual Network Request is Null

 * 400 NullVirtualNetworkRequestParameters - Virtual Network Request Parameters are Null

 * 404 SubscriptionDoesNotHaveServer - The requested server was not found

 * 404 OperationIdNotFound - The operation with Id does not exist.

 * 409 OperationCancelled - The operation has been cancelled by user.

 * 409 OperationInterrupted - The operation on the resource could not be completed because it was interrupted by another operation on the same resource.

 * 500 OperationTimedOut - The operation timed out and automatically rolled back. Please retry the operation.

*** Error Responses: ***

 * 400 InvalidResourceId - Invalid resource identifier.

 * 400 MismatchingSubscriptionWithUrl - The provided subscription did not match the subscription in the Url.

 * 400 MismatchingResourceGroupNameWithUrl - The provided resource group name did not match the name in the Url.

 * 400 MismatchingServerNameWithUrl - The provided server name did not match the name in the Url.

 * 400 NullVirtualNetworkRequest - Virtual Network Request is Null

 * 400 NullVirtualNetworkRequestParameters - Virtual Network Request Parameters are Null

 * 400 NullVirtualNetworkSubnetId - The Virtual Network Subnet Id is null

 * 404 SubscriptionDoesNotHaveServer - The requested server was not found

 * 404 VirtualNetworkRuleNotEnabled - Azure SQL Server Virtual Network Rule feature is not enabled

 * 404 OperationIdNotFound - The operation with Id does not exist.

 * 409 OperationCancelled - The operation has been cancelled by user.

 * 409 OperationInterrupted - The operation on the resource could not be completed because it was interrupted by another operation on the same resource.

SecurityAlertPolicyProperties.description: Properties of a security alert policy.

disabledAlerts.description: Specifies an array of alerts that are disabled. Allowed values are: Sql_Injection, Sql_Injection_Vulnerability, Access_Anomaly

emailAccountAdmins.description: Specifies that the alert is sent to the account administrators.

emailAddresses.description: Specifies an array of e-mail addresses to which the alert is sent.

retentionDays.description: Specifies the number of days to keep in the Threat Detection audit logs.

state.description: Specifies the state of the policy, whether it is enabled or disabled.

storageAccountAccessKey.description: Specifies the identifier key of the Threat Detection audit storage account.

storageEndpoint.description: Specifies the blob storage endpoint (e.g. https://MyAccount.blob.core.windows.net). This blob storage will hold all Threat Detection audit logs.
